passage_text: Average MLB player salaries broke the $3 million-a-year mark for the first time in 2010. Yankees players had the highest average annual salary in 2012 at $6,186,321, while players on the Oakland Athletics had the lowest average salary at $1,845,750. These salaries only show how much the players made on the field.ighest Paid Players. Alex Rodriguez of the Yankees was paid $29 million in 2012, making him the highest paid MLB player. Johan Santana of the New York Mets earned $24 million in 2012, making him the highest paid pitcher in baseball.

Tellem cites internal research that compares the salaries of the 400 highest-paid NBA players against the 400 top-paid MLB players. The results showed that the top 400 MLB players averaged $7.352 million a year versus $5.066 million for the top 400 NBA players.

List of highest paid Major League Baseball players. (Redirected from List of highest paid baseball players) Alex Rodriguez earned the highest salary in MLB in 2013 at $29,000,000. He also has the highest career earnings in MLB history. The highest paid player in Major League Baseball (MLB) from the 2013 season is New York Yankees' third baseman Alex Rodriguez with an annual salary of $29,000,000, $4 million higher than the second-highest paid player, Cliff Lee.

MLB Team Payrolls. Major League Baseball is not a league of equals when it comes to player salaries or payroll. Some teams choose to spend a lot on player salaries. For example, the New York Yankees' 2012 payroll was the highest in MLB at $197,962,289.ighest Paid Players. Because of salary caps, however, the highest-paid players donât necessarily correspond with the highest-paid agents. In the NFL, players can earn anywhere from $375,000 to $20 million from a playing contract, meaning the agent can earn between $11,250 and $600,000 per player.In MLB, with no commission limits, players earn between $400,000 and $32 million, and agents pull in anywhere from $16,000 and $4 million.The highest-paid MLB agent in 2013 was Scott Boras, who earned $11,728,037 in commissions from $248,222,750 worth of player contracts â a 4.7 percent commission.n MLB, with no commission limits, players earn between $400,000 and $32 million, and agents pull in anywhere from $16,000 and $4 million. Average MLB salaries remained fairly stagnant until the 1970s, when free agency allowed players to sell their services to the highest bidder after a certain number of years in the big leagues. Consider that in 1964, the average salary for a major league baseball player was just under $15,000 a year.ighest Paid Players. Highest-paid players, based on average annual value. In 1999, the five major league players with the biggest annual paychecks each played in the NBA. Basketball players made up 11 of the top 20 that season. This season, 11 of the 13 highest-paid players are MLB players.
